problem.fixMessage: Please use an http://bad.ex.Lang supported by this BPEL processor.
problem.message: expressionLanguage attribute refers to an unsupported language URI http://bad.ex.Lang
problem.ruleDescription: Checks the expression language for support in the BPEL model

problem.fixMessage: Please use an http://bad.query.Language supported by this BPEL processor.
problem.message: queryLanguage attribute refers to an unsupported language URI http://bad.query.Language
problem.ruleDescription: Checks the query language for support in the BPEL model

problem.fixMessage: A <receive> or <pick> with createInstance set to "true" must be present.
problem.message: There is no start activity in process "Simple"
problem.ruleDescription: Verifies that a start activity has been found in the process

problem.fixMessage: Change the import statement namespace.
problem.message: The import namespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/badNS and the imported document target namespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/sampleArtifacts do not match.
problem.ruleDescription: Imported namespace, if set, must match

problem.fixMessage: Remove the namespace attribute from the import statement.
problem.message: The targetNamespace http://eclipse.org/bpel/sampleArtifacts of the imported document is not the default namespace.
problem.ruleDescription: When import has no namespace, the targetNamespace must be empty.

problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "importType" is defined and resolvable.
problem.message: "importType" is not set on this <import> node.

problem.fixMessage: WSDL and XSD imports are allowed in BPEL 2.0, others are implementation dependent.
problem.message: The importType of http://bad.import.type is not defined in BPEL 2.0 and is not understood by this implementation.
problem.ruleDescription: Check the import type. BPEL 2.0 currently supports WSDL and XSD import types.

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: You must change the name of partnerLink "client" to something else.
problem.message: <partnerLink> name "client" is already defined in this scope/process.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks for duplicate partner link name

problem.fixMessage: You must specify either "myRole" or "partnerRole" for the <partnerLink> "noRoles"
problem.message: partnerLink "noRoles" must have "myRole" and/or "partnerRole" set.
problem.ruleDescription: myRole or partnerRole (or both) must be set

problem.fixMessage: You must remove "initializePartnerRole" from this <partnerLink>.
problem.message: The "initializePartnerRole" cannot be used on <partnerLink> that does not have partnerRole defined.
problem.ruleDescription: Check if initializePartnerRole is set on the partnerLink if partnerRole is set (or not).

problem.fixMessage: Remove the overloaded operation "start2" in portType "OverloadedPT".
problem.message: partnerLink "overloadedPL" uses portType "OverloadedPT" (via partnerLinkType "tns:Overloaded") which has an overloaded operation "start2".
problem.ruleDescription: Check for overloaded operation names in port types

problem.fixMessage: Notification operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Notification operation "operationStart" in portType "NotificationPT" (via partnerLinkType "tns:RejectThis") cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: Solicit-response operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Solicit-response operation "operationStart" in portType "SolicityResponsePT" cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: The <partnerLinkType> must define a role "ListenerResonder".
problem.message: <partnerLinkType> does not have a role "ListenerResonder" defined.

problem.fixMessage: Notification operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Notification operation "operationStart" in portType "NotificationPT" (via partnerLinkType "tns:RejectThis") cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.fixMessage: Solicit-response operations cannot be used in BPEL partnerLinkTypes.
problem.message: Solicit-response operation "operationStart" in portType "SolicityResponsePT" cannot be used in a BPEL process.
problem.ruleDescription: Check solicit-response or notification port types

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: You must change the name of variable "aDuplicateName" to something else.
problem.message: <variable> name "aDuplicateName" is already defined in this scope/process.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks for duplicate variable name

problem.context.name: messageType
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "messageType" is resolvable (check imports and value of "messageType").
problem.message: "messageType" is set to "tns:NoSuchMessage" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "messageType", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Message Type is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "type" is resolvable (check imports and value of "type").
problem.message: "type" is set to "tns:NoSuchType" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "type", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Type is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: element
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "element" is resolvable (check imports and value of "element").
problem.message: "element" is set to "tns:NoSuchElement" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "element", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Element is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: element
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "element" is resolvable (check imports and value of "element").
problem.message: "element" is set to "badprefix:NoSuchElement" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "element", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Element is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: name
problem.fixMessage: Remove the period (.) character from variable name.
problem.message: The variable name "bad.Name" contains an illegal period (.) character.
problem.ruleDescription: Checks that variable NCName further does not contain a period (.) in the name.

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Define the type of the variable "bad.Name"
problem.message: Variable "bad.Name" must be have either messageType,element, or type defined.
problem.ruleDescription: Variable type specification (either element, messaageType, or type).

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "type" is resolvable (check imports and value of "type").
problem.message: "type" is set to "xsd:integer" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "type", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Type is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "type" is resolvable (check imports and value of "type").
problem.message: "type" is set to "badprefix:integer" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "type", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Type is visible from the import(s)

problem.context.name: type
problem.fixMessage: Make sure that the "type" is resolvable (check imports and value of "type").
problem.message: "type" is set to "xsdmapped:unsignedInteger" on this <variable> node but it cannot be resolved (check value of "type", imports, WSDLs or XSDs).
problem.ruleDescription: Make sure that Type is visible from the import(s)

problem.fixMessage: Remove the handler or disable exit on standard faults.
problem.message: Standard fault "{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/03/business-process/}invalidVariables" cannot be handled in <catch> when existOnStandardFaults is set to yes.
problem.ruleDescription: When exitOnStandardFault=yes, standard fault handlers cannot be present.

problem.fixMessage: You need to move this <rethrow> activity to a fault handler.
problem.message: The <rethrow> activity named Unnamed must be in a fault handler.
problem.ruleDescription: Check rethrow placement (catch or catchAll)

problem.fixMessage: Make sure the correct variable is used in receive.
problem.message: messageType "tns:SimpleRequestMessage" of variable "input" does not match the expected messageType "null" in <receive>
